title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: So I have on the bench an 820-00138, and the customer stated their customer used a knock off charger. The charger melted and now machine is dead. I have it on the bench and it is drawing 20mA, PP3V42 is preset but PPBUS is 4.2V. I measured pins 27 & 28 on U7100 and have 30K ohms, with pin 28 being short to GND. Should I assume the ISL is dead and replace, or remove C7121 to see if short goes away? Options....

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: So I replaced U7100 and it sounds like it blew again. The computer now turns on, but the resistance between 27 & 28 is .5M Ohms.

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message:
Did you forget to replace R7121???
Check R7122 yoo, but should be good.

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: oops, yeah. R7121 is reading 625M and R7122 is 9.2K Will replace all three and report back. Weird thing happened too, when I turned it on something "popped" on the other side of the board.

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: I took them off the board to confirm. R7121 is "Open" and R7122 is 9.2K, so I would say they are bad as well

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: I forgot to conform they were ok after I changed the ISL. SO be 20.2 Ohms, Won't forget this time. I just hope nothing else is blown. I may use a donor ISL this time to test.

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: Your problem might be only bad C7121/22; don't change U7100 so fast...

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: Got it, will change other components first

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: Did you mean C7021 and C7022?

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: Replaced R7021 and R7022 and resistance between pins 27 & 28 is 17.4K ohms

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: I checked R7020 off board and is still 0.2Ohms

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: never mind about caps, was looking at a different board view

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: and I meant I checked R7120

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: Do you get correct resistance between pins 27/28 now (20 ohm aprox)?

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: No, getting 17.7K

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message:
Please, this is classic and easy thing to solve.
What else than R7121/22 and their traces can fail there???

Check R7120 too, but shouldn't get burnt, maybe corroded.

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: i did remove and check R7120, as mentioned above

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: Don't give me answer, I will try to solve myself.

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message:
I also said, R7120 should be good.
Check the other things mentioned...

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: Checked/replaced C7121/22, no change.

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: "What else than R7121/22 and their traces can fail there??? "

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message:
You didn't check R7121/22 and their traces yet???

If you already replaced U7100 and C7121/22, then again:
"What else than R7121/22 and their traces can fail there??? "

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: I replaced R7121/22 earlier and checked the traces between the ISL and R7121/22

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: somehow my replacement R7121/22 were bad... replaced them now I get 20.8 ohms.

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: So, where are you with the board now, any sign of life?

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: Yeah, board is up and running, battery charged up, It is working! I think the problem was when I started, U7100 was bad as well as resistors. I only changed U7100 to a new one. I should have replaced U7100 and the resistors at the same time. My mistake was replacing only U7100 or resistors. I was caught in a crazy game of back and forth! Replacing one killed the other until I changed U7100 and resistors.

title: 820-00138 Customer used knock off charger
message: The "crack" I heard was the new U7100 blowing because I didn't realize at the time R7121/22 were blown as well. I put another U7100 on and the board started working but when I checked pins 27 & 28 I founf 17.7K so I must have blown the new resistors when I replaced them after the new U7100 blew. Good lesson. Wasted a new U7100 though...
